summary: Constance C. Smith was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents detail her employment, salary, and pay during those periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Constance C. Smith's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the documents do not detail her specific contributions, her presence on the committee's payroll indicates she was involved in the investigation into the JFK assassination.
